Articles.Content:
Okay, so I am tampering with the config of a comand pod from a mod I have. I am basically rebalancing it for more realism and for my own personal desires. I have it a snag. To check the changes, I have to keep restarting KSP. Now, I have heard of from other modders, about a way to basically force reload all the config files and I believe it has something to do with the debug menu. I can get said menu up just fine, but I don't know how to do the config reload. Can someone with mod experience enlighten me to this secret?

P.S. I am aware that modulemanager overrides are not re-applied with a config reload.

Edited October 12, 2013 by Captain Sierra

1 - Go to Startup or Space center and open the debug menu.

2 - Click on Database

3 - Click on reload

4 - Done!

THANKS!!!!!!

Now I can get this done a LOT faster!

EDIT: my problem was I was trying to do it in the editor.

Edited October 12, 2013 by Captain Sierra
